title: Dominant Role of Oil in Economy
description: In 2021, oil rents constituted 56.38% of Libya's GDP, highlighting the country's heavy reliance on oil exports.

title: High Dependency on Natural Resources
description: Natural resources rents made up 61.03% of Libya's GDP in 2021, indicating a significant dependence on resource extraction.

title: Strong Industrial Sector Contribution
description: In 2023, the industry sector, including construction, contributed 77.34% to Libya's GDP, underscoring its industrial strength.

title: Robust Financial Services Export
description: Insurance and financial services accounted for 67.03% of service exports in 2021, showcasing the sector's export strength.

title: Substantial Bank Liquidity
description: Libyan banks had a liquid reserves to assets ratio of 214.12% in 2024, reflecting a strong liquidity position.

title: Significant Financial Services in Commercial Exports
description: In 2021, insurance and financial services made up 67.60% of Libya's commercial service exports, highlighting their importance.

title: Ample Foreign Reserves
description: Libya's total reserves were equivalent to 36.81 months of imports in 2021, indicating a strong reserve position.

title: Lowest Alternative and Nuclear Energy Usage
description: In 2020, Libya's alternative and nuclear energy usage was just 0.01% of its total energy use, one of the lowest globally.

title: Significant Decline in Government Claims
description: Libya experienced a -23.65% annual decline in claims on the central government as a percentage of broad money in 2022, indicating financial instability.

title: Low Broad Money to Reserves Ratio
description: In 2021, Libya's broad money to total reserves ratio was 0.28, reflecting limited financial reserves relative to money supply.

title: Sharp Decline in Broad Money Growth
description: Libya saw a -20.26% decrease in broad money growth in 2021, suggesting economic contraction.

title: Poor Trade and Transport Infrastructure
description: Libya's logistics performance index for trade and transport infrastructure was rated at 1.7 in 2022, indicating poor quality.

title: Low Overall Logistics Performance
description: In 2022, Libya's overall logistics performance index was 1.9, highlighting inefficiencies in logistics operations.

title: Negative Gross Savings Rate
description: Libya's adjusted gross savings rate was -14.16% of GNI in 2020, reflecting a lack of savings at the national level.

title: High Negative Net Savings
description: In 2020, Libya's adjusted net savings, including particulate emission damage, was -$13.77 billion, indicating unsustainable economic practices.

title: Negative Net Savings Excluding Emission Damage
description: Libya's adjusted net savings, excluding particulate emission damage, was -$13.47 billion in 2020, showing economic challenges.

title: Negative Taxes Less Subsidies
description: In 2023, Libya's taxes less subsidies on products were -9.85 billion LCU, indicating fiscal challenges.

title: Negative Constant Taxes Less Subsidies
description: Libya's constant taxes less subsidies on products were -4.42 billion LCU in 2023, reflecting economic difficulties.

title: Low Rule of Law Confidence
description: In 2023, Libya's rule of law percentile rank lower bound was 0.94, indicating a lack of confidence in legal institutions.

title: Minimal Female Alcohol Consumption
description: In 2020, Libya had one of the lowest female alcohol consumption rates globally, at 0.002 liters per capita.
